website_summaries.verdict: This heavy-duty, micro-perforated colander is smooth to the touch and dishwasher safe. The only thing it can't do is rinse dry rice and quinoa.
pros: Rice and spaghetti won't fall through micro-perforations
Stable draining ring base won't tip
Not meant for rinsing dry rice or quinoa
cons: Base is solid, so if you place it in the center of your sink, it will block drainage

customer_reviews.title: Handle fell off - company told me to tape it back on
customer_reviews.text: The specifications for the product mention it is meant to "last a lifetime" - this is not the case. I had one of the handles fall off recently. When I reached out to the company to get help with the issue, they suggested I "tape or glue" the handle back on. What? I would go with another company that stands behind their products.
customer_reviews.author: Giova

customer_reviews.title: got rust after only one use
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand why this has so many good reviews. It's definitely not stainless steel as it got rust after only one use.
customer_reviews.author: sh

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine while the handle stayed on
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine while the handle stayed on. Bought in February 2016, handle fell off July 2017. We only ever hand washed it. Seems like it should last longer than 17 months. EDIT: So, Epica Products stood by their product; apparently it has a "Complete Replacement Warranty". They replaced the colander, easy, peasy, no fuss. If you have any problems with your Bellamain Micro-perforated Stainless Steel 5-quart Colander contact Epica products at support@epicaproducts.com or call 888-507-0576.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Great...while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: This was a great colander while it lasted. Unfortunately one of the handles popped off after a year and therefore past the warranty. We always hand cleaned...never put it in a dishwasher. After searching reviews it appears this has happened to others as well. Like I said, loved it while it lasted, although I will not purchase again. Also, the I emailed the company and they did respond so that is a bonus, but they said they could not offer anything because it was outside the warranty. Fair enough, but I like cooking products to last a bit longer than a year.
customer_reviews.author: RBnVA

customer_reviews.title: awesome Colander!
customer_reviews.text: I love this colander so much that I just ordered a second one. I did not realize the difference it would make, but this drains so much easier than my old plastic OXO colander and is easier to clean. The OXO is going to the yard sale and I am a believer. Update October 24, 2015: The more I use this colander, the more I love it. It's holding up well and is sturdy. I have a small kitchen, so I'm attaching a picture of how I store mine in on the side of my refrigerator.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rusting after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Had this colander for about 3 months and have always hadwashed it. Nice large size and works well. However, started to notice rust on the inside bottom holes where it is welded to the base and on the underside of base. Hard to clean in that area too. Past the return date so sadly will have to trash.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Defective handle
customer_reviews.text: The welds on the handle broke and I haven't even had it for 6 months
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Recieved with handle not attached.
customer_reviews.text: Seems like it would be a good colander but sadly the handles don't seem to be attached very well, received mine with one of the handles not attached and no way place it back on.
customer_reviews.author: D. Castro

customer_reviews.title: Good build quality but doesn't work with rice
customer_reviews.text: I've had this a long time now and we still really like it, its sturdy and has been through many uses and washes and is still holding up. It does not work for rice, specifically basmati rice. I don't like the starchy taste of unwashed rice, but if you try to use this with uncooked rice lots of grains fall through and some get stuck in the holes and its really difficult to clean. Its a pain to have to have 2 colanders for draining pasta versus draining rice. The "micro perforated" holes aren't micro enough for my uses.
customer_reviews.author: Thor

customer_reviews.title: Made in China
customer_reviews.text: Claims to be a “small American business” yet the product is made in China.
customer_reviews.author: damagecontrol

customer_reviews.title: Easiest to clean colander ever.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this colander for five years now. It is hands down the best colander I have ever used. It's so much easier to clean than wire mesh, it looks really good, and it's a soldier. I don't have a dishwasher, and because this is stainless steel with lots of holes, there's no edge to it. You can drain the fattiest, greasiest food in it and a quick wash later, squeaky clean. I harp,on this because mesh is so much harder to wash, and plastic ends up all tacky. I wish these guys made a skillet splash top. I'd buy it in a second.
customer_reviews.author: cristobal

customer_reviews.title: Bent and Misshaped
customer_reviews.text: I received this product in a box, thinking it would come out fine. When I took it out, it was bent on the bottom, lopsided, and a part of the bottom piece wasn’t secured on, about to pop off. I was extremely disappointed on the quality and durability. Clearly, it is easily bendable and can become misshaped.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not packaged for shipping, but OK once you beat it back into shape
customer_reviews.text: This colander was crushed when it arrived at my doorstep. My spouse was able to knock it back into some semblance of its original shape, and the welds keeping the stand on the bottom of it stayed in place. We washed it, drained some pasta, and washed it again, and despite being a bit dented, it works all right. Even with dents, it both strains and washes up more nicely than our older plastic (BPA-free, but still plastic) strainers. But if you can buy this one in a store, rather than getting it shipped, that's probably the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Coral

customer_reviews.title: GOOD SIZE AND STURDY
customer_reviews.text: My ages old plastic colander gave up the ghost and I replaced it with this unit. This colander appears to be well made and good quality stainless. It is large enough to drain 12 chicken breasts with ease. A nice addition for any kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Roy in Brookings

customer_reviews.title: Rusted instantly
customer_reviews.text: Used once and ran it through the dishwasher. Rusted around the joints and screw holes. Extremely disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Meets all our needs.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great strainer / colander. Whether you are just rinsing off lettuce or draining the water from your pasta this strainer is great. Our previous strainer had larger holes so ever time we drained rice or macaroni we ended up with a sink full of the same. The tiny holes on this colander allow you to drain nearly anything. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Hoesing

customer_reviews.title: Arrived broken
customer_reviews.text: This arrived clearly dented and broken. It doesn't sit straight because the one half miss-shapen. Very displeased with this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice!
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what we needed. Our ancient colander finally had to be replaced, as it was plastic, and one of the handles snapped off. Plastic probably wasn't a good idea to begin with, so we were happy to order this stainless steel version. The price is much better than the one for the brand that America's Test Kitchen recommended, and as far as we can tell, the features and quality are probably as good. It is quite sturdy and heavy duty. So far it's working just great!
customer_reviews.author: Greeny

customer_reviews.title: This is a very nice colander/strainer. I purchased it to use with rice
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice colander/strainer. I purchased it to use with rice, as my other colander allowed the grains to slip through. This one does not, though the odd grain will still go through if it hits at just the right angle, which is unavoidable. I love the foot on this, too, as it keeps whatever I'm draining from accidentally getting hit with water in the bottom of the sink (like, say, if you accidentally seal the drain with the foot of this colander :-). I'm very happy with this purchase, as it's good quality and cleans up beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: D Walker

customer_reviews.title: Product Not as Described
customer_reviews.text: Upon opening the Amazon box I noticed that the product box was damaged/torn. While this was minor and the colander was not damaged, the colander handles were welded, not riveted, to the colander. The product description indicated the handles were riveted. Since I was concerned the item was not as described, I returned this item.
customer_reviews.author: ASF

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful! Replaced my old stained aluminum  collander
customer_reviews.text: Too early to judge durability but seems very substantial while still being lightweight. I especially like the smaller perforations all over the bowl -- drains very well and cappellini doesn't fall through the holes. Small base seems firmly attached which is a problem with some products. Stainless steel is bright and shiny so I can hang it by the large handles from a pot hanging kitchen rack. Reasonable price for the quality and passes the test for both function and appearance.
customer_reviews.author: bill

customer_reviews.title: It works - better built than most.  Spend the extra $2 and get this one.
customer_reviews.text: It's a colander, and colander's things. Build quality is actually pretty good. Not a cheap wire set that's flimsy, but is actually a contiguous plate of thin sheet-metal with fine holes drilled through it at a high density, making for a pretty sturdy and well made colander. Spend the extra couple bucks and get this one, it's better made than most.
customer_reviews.author: CampPerryHighPower

customer_reviews.title: Quality colander
customer_reviews.text: I recently had a plastic colander which I have owned for over 16 years develop a hole large enough to have macaroni fall through it. Since I needed to replace it, I looked at on-line reviews to see what colander I should buy. The Bellemain micro-perforated stainless steel was very highly ranked. I feel that this colander met my expectations. It seems well made and it drains well. It also is relatively large which is good when making food for groups of people. I would recommend this colander for someone looking for a good functional and durable colander.
customer_reviews.author: doneill

customer_reviews.title: The absolute best colander!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a few months now. It actually took me a while to get rid of my old favorite and start using this one. I love this colander!! It's a good size, liquid runs through it quickly with no splashback and the height is perfect. It's also easy to clean despite the hole sizes. I've put it in the dishwasher with no problems. You won't be disappointed with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I needed a colander with fine mesh to strain bone broth which I was making ...
customer_reviews.text: Impressive Quality product. I needed a colander with fine mesh to strain bone broth which I was making for nutritional supplement. Most of the strainers were too large so bone pieces were getting into the broth. I expected something with a mesh like net but I was very Impressed with the quality of this product. It is not a wire mesh but fine perforations in a metal colander. It is made very well and will last a very long time. I would recommend this product to everyone. Why get something more flimsy when you can get this substantial strainer at such a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Ciemny

customer_reviews.title: Big fail, all rice goes through
customer_reviews.text: Check out video. A mere three second shake takes out at least 20 rice grains. That too, the large basmati rice grains. Completely useless, and incorrect advertising. (Says good for washing rice). One star.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Drains really well and is much sturdier than mesh strainers
customer_reviews.text: I used it to drain salted chopped tomatoes and also to rinse and strain rice for sushi. It performed really well at both tasks, allowing the excess water to drain completely from the tomatoes without pooling and the perforations were small enough that they didn't allow the short grain rice to escape. It's a good size, too. I was able to stir and agitate the contents without it spilling over the side. Finally, it is constructed of a solid material, so holds it's shape unlike most mesh strainers that seem to flatten out over time.
customer_reviews.author: Tony J

customer_reviews.title: A first-rate piece of necessary kitchen equipment
customer_reviews.text: I've had it for two weeks, used it maybe ten times: so far, it appears to be a really first rate piece of kitchen equipment. The entire colendare is full of holes, so there is no "blind spot" where water can accumulate. And it has been easy to wash, really just a good rinse is all that's necessary. It's large, so I can fill it with several boxes of berries, and yet it is light so it doesn't add any weight if I'm washing heavy fruits like pears. All in all, I am very happy with this. Recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Solid colander - Not good for washing rice though
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a colander that I could rinse rice in, and thought that the micro-perforations in this would be OK, but they're just large enough where rice grains can sneak through. A bit of a bummer, but that's on me for not checking closely. Otherwise, this is a well-constructed colander and is easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Tran

customer_reviews.title: Just think it’s the best
customer_reviews.text: I use thus constantly and it’s the best I’ve ever had., Cleans up easily because it’s very sturdy. Hold a lot. Still looks perfect. The bottom is made so water doesn’t collect and rust. I always wash it but it is dishwasher safe I really did a lot of research before I decided. This was a very good decision, highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Durable and functional, but not easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: While durable and functional, I found this colander was not easy to clean. While the inside is smooth, the outside is rough so if you have any seasonings or herbs in what you're straining, they can get stuck and be hard to scrub off. You'll have to wash it immediately after use to keep particles from drying on it.
customer_reviews.author: Mar-Bar

customer_reviews.title: As good as Grandmas
customer_reviews.text: that I have been using for decades and couldn't find anything close to it that allowed pasta to drain completely without me having to stir the pasta or shake the strainer
customer_reviews.author: farmersmouse

customer_reviews.title: This colander is the best I've owned
customer_reviews.text: This colander is the best I've owned. I bought it because it was similar, though less expensive, than the one recommended by America's Test Kitchen. That makes it perfect. It drains instantly, so pasta doesn't continue cooking. It's tiny holes stop fine pasta from slipping through. It washes up beautifully. Look no further..... and enjoy the money you saved!!
customer_reviews.author: Mom of two

customer_reviews.title: Effectively replaces the need for both a colander and a strainer...
customer_reviews.text: This colander meets my expectations. It replaces both an old colander and an old strainer; effectively does the work of both and is easy to clean. The colander is well made with the handles being quite sturdy. As one reviewer commented, the only problem is if you place the colander directly of the sink drain so the water pools in the sink. Her solution is simple; just offset the strainer across the drain and the problem is solved. I would buy this strainer again.
customer_reviews.author: SuzyQ

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Got this to replace our plastic colander that melted a bit on the hot stove. So far works fine. We set it in the sink to drain pasta then set it back in the pot once drained to serve from. Cleanup is average for a colander -- a bit tough to get all the noodle residue out. I'm sure it'd be lots easier in the dishwasher I just choose to hand wash it the majority of the time. So far handles are fine and no noticeable rust.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Frazee

customer_reviews.title: Serviceable Product; Not as Durable as I Expected
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this a few weeks ago and it works fine. I purchased it because it is made of stainless steel and my previous colander is made from an unspecified metal. It's large enough to handle most straining jobs I have. My only complaint is that part of the base was bent when we received it. And no I didn't send it back. This time of year, I don't have time to repackage and send it back and wait for a new one. So I cannot comment on the vendor's return policy/practice. It's serviceable for kitchen use even with a partially bent base. But it tells me the steel is not as durable as I thought it would be.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Melton Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this colander for a couple weeks, but so far I'm impressed with it. It seems to be well made and sturdy. I like that the holes are small making it more versatile for me to use with a variety of foods. Hopefully, it will hold up for a long time. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: paulina

customer_reviews.title: Order with something larger, or shipping will smoosh it
customer_reviews.text: This seemed like a really nice strainer. Unfortunately I never got to use it because whoever packed it in the warehouse literally picked a box smaller than the dimensions and just smashed it all in there until it fit, completely wrecking the strainer.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Parnell

customer_reviews.title: The handle fell off!
customer_reviews.text: I used this about five times. I went to wash it, and the handle fell off. It has poor welding. What a waste of money! Amazon only has a 30 day return period. So there is nothing for the consumer to do when they receive some cheaply made item that falls apart after the return period.
customer_reviews.author: Sadie

customer_reviews.title: Finally, a grown up kitchen aid for myself
customer_reviews.text: I have been using a plastic colander forever. It was hard to clean, stained and just plain funky. When visiting my daughter at thanksgiving she was browsing amazon kitchen items she could use for her birthday in January. This colander was among the items she chose. When I got home days later I used my sickly plastic colander and there and then I decided I’m ready too for a “real” colander. I ordered it and with my Prime account , it arrived I two days. It’s perfect, looks great, cleaning is s breeze. Seems like my daughter knew best.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Gray

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Bought it around 2 months ago looking at the good reviews, but rusted after couple of uses. Even the 5 bucks one at Target lasted much longer than this. Don't believe the reviews here.
customer_reviews.author: js0823

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy, Great Colander
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautiful colander and not just in looks. The micro-perforations allow water to drain without having to shake all the ingredients around. And the tiny holes allow you to strain rice and other small items without them falling through. It's very well made, easy to clean, and the base raises it high enough so that you can use it in the sink without worry of your ingredients coming into contact with anything else in the sink. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Teeni

customer_reviews.title: Rice goes through strainer
customer_reviews.text: It seems like an okay strainer but I was very disappointed when my rice was being washed down the drain. With it saying micro-perforated and even its product description said rice wouldn't run out of it, it still did. I still kept the strainer, because I didn't have one for noodles yet. But I will keep looking for something to rinse my rice in. Construction seems pretty eh, not horrible but not amazing, basically you are getting what you paid for.
customer_reviews.author: Seth

customer_reviews.title: My grandson chose this . . .
customer_reviews.text: Actually, I have not seen this colander. My bachelor grandson was visiting me and commented he needed a metal mesh colander to drain spaghetti in -- something that the spaghetti would not fall through. So, we went on line and he selected this colander as the one he wanted. Super Grandma (ahem) that I am, I ordered it to be delivered to his residence. I am giving the colander 5 stars just because "the kid" was so sure it fit the bill and was not interested in any other colander we looked at. His Grandma!
customer_reviews.author: Rose39

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Loved it, but started to rust at the weld points about 6 months later... :( See pictures.
customer_reviews.author: R. Smalley

customer_reviews.title: Big Food Cleanser
customer_reviews.text: I use this everytime I make pasta or cleanse fruits & veggies. It’s a large size, durable metal material, looks great, and allows to wash foods well in it. It can be a little difficult to clean since it has small holes, but if you use a good scrubber or Brilo you can get everything off of if.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had had this earlier!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best strainer. I have others but this is perfect for kitchen use. I can see that I will mainly use this one. We have also started making cheese and this is perfect so as not to lose some of the tiny curds. I highly recommend this strainer.
customer_reviews.author: Believer

customer_reviews.title: Great colander
customer_reviews.text: This is a great colander. I'm a big advocate of metal colanders in general. The base keeps it stable when I'm dumping a heavy pot full of pasta water, keeps it above the drainage water that hasn't made it down the drain yet, etc. And I love the small holes that don't let any thin pasta through. We are thin spaghetti eaters, and vermicelli often made their way through the larger holes in my previous colander. And this particular one is well-made and sturdy. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: M. K. Herman

customer_reviews.title: Poor workmanship
customer_reviews.text: Less than 30 days and the weld on the handle and weld on the bottom rim broke. Very poor workmanship in that aspect.
customer_reviews.author: HappyBrad

customer_reviews.title: Nice size, nice size holes, nice quality.
customer_reviews.text: After years of "old-style" hand-me-down colanders with star patterns of holes and what-not, I finally sprung for this micro-perf. LOVE IT. It's a nice large size which works well for me because I cook lots of things in big batches, and the holes drain even fine pasta very well, but are still large enough to not get those little starchy plugs like in a screen-type strainer. I've had it for several months now and it appears to be holding up well in every way-- both finish and construction. I run it through the dish washer every third or fourth time I was it and it comes out great.
customer_reviews.author: Megan in Colorado

customer_reviews.title: The "Colander" which can last many years!
customer_reviews.text: Having purchased several in this size range, this is one of the least expensive and yet higher quality products. Since I'm tough on kitchen equipment, stainless steel IS the way to go and you'll not be unhappy for the price.
customer_reviews.author: MaxGyver

customer_reviews.title: shiny things that work really well!
customer_reviews.text: This was ordered as a replacement for a similar colander that disappeared when I moved. I thought it was a pretty good price and I had high hopes for the quality. I was not disappointed!! This is a beautiful, restaurant-quality colander that comes out of the dishwasher looking like new. It's so pretty I hung it on the wall rather than hide it in a drawer! Love it and use it virtually every day!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: So I hated my old colander, which let pieces of food drain through along with the water or grease. This doesn't do that. It's sturdy, and there are small enough holes that you won't lose pieces of your food through. It's dishwasher safe, so you just throw it in and you're done. I definitely would recommend purchasing this item.
customer_reviews.author: kereyn1965

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: At last this new design is a revelation and actually works better than imagined. After many many years of kitchen colander use I was convinced those newly designed tiny hole colanders would not be efficient for quickly draining produce or pasta. I was very wrong. My concern over the previous multiple colanders I have tried was holes placed in many of them were too few on the bottom too allow sufficient drainage. This stainless steel micro colander is perfect and in fact drains far more quickly and sufficiently than its predecessors. I love the size and the quality.
customer_reviews.author: llindalu

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a strainer that had a big platform to sit up on so the boiling water going down the drain wouldn't back up and get onto the food. I previously had a plastic one that sat flat in the sink, so this was a welcome upgrade! I love that the holes are small enough that smaller things such as macaroni noodles don't fall through, that was a big issue with my plastic strainer. The only thing I'm not thrilled about is how hard it is to clean. The tiny holes tend to grab onto food (particularly broccoli) and its hard to get everything off. That small issue is a welcome trade off for an otherwise great product.
customer_reviews.author: Mel Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Handy for cheesemaking.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for cheesemaking. Perfect for draining large curd cheeses (not Ricotta or Brousse) and you don't need cheesecloth because the holes are very small. Quite sturdy and easily holds 2-3 pounds of curds. You can even salt and mill curds in this. If you do small curd cheeses, line with a cloth that is quite a bit larger so you can pull up the corners, tie, and hang drain the curds as the tiny holes with a cloth don't let it drain very fast. Most of the time I put the curds in, put a towel over, and come back the next morning and they are drained.
customer_reviews.author: K. Rowe

customer_reviews.title: Buy something else
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing "professional" about this colander. Very lightweight. Very cheaply made. Disappointing. Hard to believe all the 5 star reviews are legit
customer_reviews.author: Littlekrok

customer_reviews.title: Much nicer than I even expected.
customer_reviews.text: I shopped around to find a nice colander that looked like it was easy to clean before I bot this one, but it still exceeded my expectations when it came. It's really a sturdy item and is indeed very easy to clean because it's perforated stainless instead of like a braided screen material. Handles are strong, too. I'm very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: SteveTCook

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Colander
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an old colander I have had for about 50 years. This product has opened my eyes to the fact that I should have upgraded long ago! It is the perfect size, drains beautifully, stands where it is placed in the sink and is exactly the correct weight. The holes are exactly the right size to drain well without losing and angel-hair pasta. I love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Ol Ron

customer_reviews.title: REALLY nice colander
customer_reviews.text: This is a really well-made and high-quality colander. I love the size (5 quarts) and the micro-perforations -- it's perfect for small things like herbs. I'm very happy with my purchase and I highly recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Daphne62

customer_reviews.title: A high quality Colander
customer_reviews.text: This looks of very high quality (it is made from heavy Stainless Steel). Even in the Philippines with high humidity, it is spotless and works great! I had a colander that I had gotten from my grandmother and had to leave it when I came to the Philippines - I now have something I believe will probably be passed on to others in my family.
customer_reviews.author: gbdusmc

customer_reviews.title: Super sturdy, LOVE THIS PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.text: high quality steel! We own a machine shop and we use these colanders for draining oily parts in a cleaning tank. It works perfectly. I love that it's all one solid piece so you never worry about the weight of something causing the handles to fold in or break.
customer_reviews.author: D. Bealer

customer_reviews.title: STYLE AND SIZE GOOD
customer_reviews.text: Style and size are exactly what I wanted. I wanted to replace my old Tupperware of the same design, but it had larger holes. (Trying to get rid of plastics from my kitchen/food.) The only issue I may have with this one is that the tiny holes may be harder to clean out than my old colander. And it almost feels like a grater on the outside of the colander (just a little rough from the holes being punched through).
customer_reviews.author: R. Rodriquez

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, dishwasher safe, ample room
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size! Exactly what I was looking for, actually better than I expected. Having a base on the bottom to set down is perfect so that the bottom of the strainer is not sitting in the sink. I have 4 different types of strainers at home and find myself exclusively using this one for everything. Sturdy and dishwasher safe, it has quickly become a key tool in our kitchen. Would definitely recommend purchasing!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: The little holes make it nice and easy to drain water from rice, pasta, or fats/greases from meats, etc., without losing any of our food. Tough to clean, though, but I often throw it in the dishwasher, all good there.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Not worth 20. That's for sure
customer_reviews.text: I like this product but it is not worth 20 dollars. The "metal" is starting to turn brown on the bottom and it feels very cheap. Would recommend if the price wasn't so dang high.the should re price it for under 10 cause that's what it feels it's worth.
customer_reviews.author: tianna

customer_reviews.title: Rusty after 2 use
customer_reviews.text: It says stainless steel. But it started staining (rusting) after two use.
customer_reviews.author: Vignesh K Vijayakumar

customer_reviews.title: Best collander I've ever used.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this colander for my husband. He kept complaining about the old porcelian one we had with very few holes and said it didn't drain the noodles very well. Then I purchased the Bellemain collander. Wow! Was he ever impressed! It was his best Christmas present. It really made me smile. Thank you for making a great colander. If anyone asks about it, I'll be happy to refer them to you. It drains beautifully!
customer_reviews.author: Moonshine

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy drainer / strainer/ colander
customer_reviews.text: Great colander / strainer with good base to place it in the sink so the water can drain out. This product goes through dishwasher fine. We use it for straining hot spaghetti water, washing strawberries in cold water, and anything you would want to drain. It's nice and sturdy for pouring ears of corn into it when draining the hot water from the pot. We replaced the plastic version we had with this stainless steel model and are very happy with the change!
customer_reviews.author: Austen reader 1775

customer_reviews.title: This works much better, and the stand underneath works much better than ...
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an older plastic colander with this. The stand underneath works much better than my previous version because it elevates the bowl which is important when draining foods. Stainless steel is better for draining hot foods like pasta, and the micro-perforated design keeps food from falling through the holes. Good design!
customer_reviews.author: b

customer_reviews.title: Tremendous value for your money.  These things are great!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a RSVP colander this summer and it was, hands down, one of the best purchases I had made in ears. I love it. At Christmas, I wanted to give two of them out to my kids and I noticed this Bellemain strainer for $10.00 less. It sure looked the same, reviews were pretty good so I bought two of them. When they arrived I checked them out and confirmed that are just as well built. Very sturdy! Feedback from my kids is GREAT! These things are a absolute bargain and highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Turmatic

customer_reviews.title: Great size, multi-functional
customer_reviews.text: We were in desperate need of a new colander and this one fits our needs perfectly! The five quart may seem quite large, but we think it's great because spaghetti, beans, noodles, rice...whatever...fits in this colander with room to spare, so nothing spills out over the top. It's lightweight, but sturdy and appears to be wellmade. The stand keeps this upright without any problem. It washes easily by hand and using the dishwasher. We've been using this for about a month and would highly recommend it so far. It's stainless steel, so it shouldn't rust.
customer_reviews.author: ~purplemoon~

customer_reviews.title: What I love about this colander (besides the solid quality construction) was ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this colander for a kitchen at new house. What I love about this colander (besides the solid quality construction) was the size of the holes, small and more than my old one; also the size -- larger than the typical colander; no more pasta down the drain -- great product and great to support a local (US) business. I expect this colander to last for many, many years. No rust at all after maybe 20 washings. Obviously a high quality kitchen utensil. I will definitely buy more items made by Belleman. I was not compensated for this review.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Warren

customer_reviews.title: This strainer saved my 16 year marriage.
customer_reviews.text: This pasta strainer saved my 16 year marriage. After years of not owning a pasta strainer and numerous arguments, I decided to buy this. My wife once again loves me. The pasta and fruit drain miraculously. How could I have been living life for so long without one? Fellas, always remember, a happy wife means a happy life.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Bogacki

customer_reviews.title: A functional piece of art
customer_reviews.text: Usually a large capacity strainer and fine mesh are a contradiction in terms. The holes usually make the strainer too delicate. Not with this one. Am very pleased to finally have a strainer large enough for pasta for six that won't start bending or deforming. Also happy to have the stainless steel rather than aluminum for both cleanliness and appearance. An excellent choice. Followup: This strainer is a joy. Very handsome as well as functional, both for straining and for holding fruit or whatever occurs to you. You simply can't go wrong with this purchase, particularly at such a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: abycats

customer_reviews.title: A GEM of a product!
customer_reviews.text: This colander arrived in perfect condition. I used it a few times and it works like a dream. I saw it was the #1 rated colander on America's Test Kitchen so I decided to get it since my old cermic covered metal colander was rusting. Rust is something I won't have to worry about with this product. Handles were ample sized as was the stand which works nicely when sitting in the sink! I highly recommend this "gem" for the kitchen!
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Buchar

customer_reviews.title: Great strainer
customer_reviews.text: Great strainer. Very sturdy. Holds up well in the wash. It's a nice big size. It has a nice base on it so it sets down evenly and things dont spill. Great for straining spaghetti noodles.
customer_reviews.author: Jrc85

customer_reviews.title: Great collander
customer_reviews.text: This is a great collander. I've just had it for a week, and it works great for pasta and rice. It drains fast because of the many different holes. It appears well constructed and is attractive. It's a great replacement for our last collander, which had paint that chipped off and drained slowly and let rice fall through the holes. This one is much better.
customer_reviews.author: Daddy-O !

customer_reviews.title: Love item, just teach Amazon how to pack!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice colander! Would be even nicer if Amazon could get it shipped to you not dented. First one was smashed, second one has small dents in it and this is a very sturdy colander that does not bend very easy.
customer_reviews.author: S. Schwager

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to your kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and clean. Sturdy mesh won’t bend, and didn’t dent when dropped about 3 feet. Large handles make holding easy and it didn’t heat up when draining boiling water through. I’d hand wash it, because dishwasher detergents might make rust spots show..
customer_reviews.author: B.H.

customer_reviews.title: did not clog when draining fine noodles and was sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This is a gift, so I don't know exactly how the recipient will feel about it, but based on his desire to have a colander that drained well, did not clog when draining fine noodles and was sturdy. This looks like a well built tool. I like it especially that it is made in America. Hard to find these days. Note: He had been given three other colanders in the past, all made in China. They were either cheaply made but most of all didn't have enough holes at the bottom so they didn't drain well.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this colander. The colander full of pasta or other food sits above the sink, out of water drained from the food. No more pasta slipping through the large perforations of my old colander, or sitting in cooking water because the old colander did not drain well. No more scalding myself because my old colander required me to hold it out of the sink so that the food did not sit in a sink full of cooking water. I am very pleased. Thank you for a terrific product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great, Sturdy Colander
customer_reviews.text: The construction of this colander is super sturdy, and it is a nice size for washing fruits and vegetables, as well as straining pasta . The holes were a tad bigger than I would have likes, as a few grains of rice were able to slip through when rinsing, but otherwise, it does a very good job. Like most colanders, it isn't super easy to clean, but it isn't necessarily difficult either. I don't have a dishwasher, but I am sure it would hold up well to being washed in one.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Vander Plaats

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Well made.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality colander. Holes are small enough not to let food through, but there are plenty of them to make sure the food drains quickly and efficiently. It seems pretty sturdy, too. It is mesh, so it's not going to take a heavy beating without getting bent, but under normal use it should do just fine. The base of the colander raises it up off the floor of the sink high enough so that you won't end up with a lot of the water backwashing into the colander. It was less expensive than many others that looked exactly the same, so that is a selling point, too.
customer_reviews.author: Bannarino

customer_reviews.title: Multi purpose
customer_reviews.text: - Great for straining big bathches of stock/broth. - draining pasta - washing fruit and veggies - fruit bowl Easy to clean. Looks nice. Definitely one of my better investments.
customer_reviews.author: gg

customer_reviews.title: Best colander I've used.
customer_reviews.text: I think the best thing about this colander is that the perforations are close together and all through the bowl--no more puddles of water for my freshly washed vegetables where the "artistic" layout of the holes allows the water to pool. Possibly my best kitchen purchase in several years. The only suggestion I can think of for improvement would be a long handle on one side. I like a little more maneuverability when dumping steaming pasta, just a few more inches between my skin and the steam.
customer_reviews.author: JPville

customer_reviews.title: worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought it 1.5 years ago. I seldom write reviews but this colander works so well I decided to write one. It works like it's supposed to. I use it 1-2 times a week. No problems at all. It's one of those things that you use, put away and forget about it because it works so well so you don't have to think about it. Before I bought it I read some reviews complaining about rust and broken handles it so that's way I waited that long to write review. I wanted to see if I'd had any problems with it but I don't after 18 months it still looks like it's brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Voytek

customer_reviews.title: Super nice!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect. Rice falls threw the holes, For a size comparison. But spaghetti noodles do not. The only thing is it’s a little hard to clean. Seems like no matter how much I scrub it there is always some spots left on it, but for stainless steal, that’s kinda what you get.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Pierson

customer_reviews.title: got it from recommendation from America's Test Kitchen and totally worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a recommendation from America's Test Kitchen, totally worth it. Top quality stainless, no rust, tall enough for all the veggies I'm prepping for up to a weeks worth of chow. If you wash and dry this colander, shake the colander to knock out the water retained in the micro-perforations in the colander, it'll keep your drying towel from being sopping wet drying it.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: You don't realize how important a good colander is until you have a 'Good' colander!
customer_reviews.text: I too saw this colander on America's Test Kitchen and loved the comparison and how this one came up as the best. I used it the same day it arrived, fast shipping, by the way. Suddenly my life seemed so much smoother, maybe its my imagination! I was making pasta that day so, perfect timing. Drained fast, I did a quick hot soapy wash and rinse. Then I proceeded to to pull 3 other strainers from my cabinet to donate to Goodwill! This is a must have. Do it. You will have no regrets!!
customer_reviews.author: Charm Carm

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and functions perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fabulous strainer! I had another kind for 25 years that didn't drain well, and bent when I dropped it because it was hot. I have endured it like a dripping faucet, not worth the effort to replace it. However, I saw this one and the urge overtook me, and I am thrilled with it! I do get excited about little things when they work well. This strainer drains beautifully, no pooling up of water when rinsing beans, rice and other things, and the holes are small enough that none of the good stuff escapes, just all that water. Inexpensive, and functions perfectly...what more can you ask for?!
customer_reviews.author: KT

customer_reviews.title: FWIW, this colander appears to be manufactured of the ...
customer_reviews.text: FWIW, this colander appears to be manufactured of the same Chinesium and in the same Communist Chinese sweatshop as ATK's top rated "RSVP International Endurance Precision Pierced 5 Qt. Colander". As such, Bellemain is a more affordable source of a tainted stainless steel colander...
customer_reviews.author: Polish Infidel

customer_reviews.title: Perfect colander.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this colander for myself and after using it once I immediately bought one for my daughter. It's large and wide, affording excellent drainage. You can pop it in the dishwasher or clean easily by hand.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen M. Mackler

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: This colander is perfect for rinsing smaller food items, like rice or lentils, with out them slipping through the cracks. It’s easy enough to clean and good quality. Slightly bigger than I expected...
customer_reviews.author: Caitriona Hayes

customer_reviews.title: This colander is GREAT! It has holes every where to allow better ...
customer_reviews.text: This colander is GREAT! It has holes every where to allow better drainage of any moisture of liquid. It used to take twice the time to "dink around" and tilt the utensil different ways to make sure the wasn't residual moisture. The shape and quality of the item is great too. Product is easy to clean with a bristle brush wand with soap attachment! Would like to get a graduated set of these from small to large eventually!
customer_reviews.author: Val R

customer_reviews.title: It is a great product. I had been looking for colander with ...
customer_reviews.text: So far I have purchased two of these colanders. It is a great product. I had been looking for colander with small holes that can be used in rice preparation (draining partially cooked rice) without loosing its shape either due to high temperature or weight. My mother, who is very hard to please, used this colander when she was cocking at my house and that resulted in me having to buy another one for myself again. It is that good. The product is well made and sturdy, the capacity is great. and it cleans up really well. even after draining hot starchy water through it. Great product and American made. What else can you ask for?
customer_reviews.author: K2

customer_reviews.title: Best Colander You Can Find
customer_reviews.text: This colander is amazing. I have tried multiple different types of colanders, including the collapsible kinds, and I was never happy with them because either there is not enough holes or the holes are too big and food slips through or the material is crap. This colander is covered in tiny holes so you can drain the water out without losing any food and it is made with quality material. I don't see myself replacing this colander any time soon!
customer_reviews.author: trentdk

customer_reviews.title: Micro-perforated holes are approximately 1/16 inch diameter. Larger than uncooked QUINOA.
customer_reviews.text: Nicely designed stainless steel colander. With approximately 1/16" diameter holes, the holes are too large to be described as "Micro-perforated." Grains like QUINOA (rinsing suggested prior to cooking) pass easily through the colander holes. The sharp edges on the holes makes cleaning a challenge after colandering cooked pasta.
customer_reviews.author: Cougar97738

customer_reviews.title: Just like the pros use!
customer_reviews.text: Quality, easy to use and store. I was worried about food getting stuck between the homes and base but it does not. Washes well in dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Kbone

customer_reviews.title: Great colander
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fir draining a lot of things and not losing them through the holes. Also great fir washing rice! Perfect size. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: orly

product_meta.title: Bellemain Micro-perforated Stainless Steel Colander-Dishwasher Safe (5-Quart)
feature_bullets: RICE AND SPAGHETTI WON’T FALL THROUGH THE HOLES: A big improvement over both old-fashioned colanders with gaping holes and mesh colanders. They drain fast and won’t clog up with food.

QUICK DRAINING MICRO-PERFORATIONS: Tiny, closely spaced holes mean your food drains fast without having to tilt the bowl. The stable draining ring base won’t tip over and won’t leave your food sitting in a puddle.
RUST-PROOF DISHWASHER SAFE 18/8 STAINLESS STEEL: You'll be impressed with the quality of the heavy duty steel with riveted handles. Designed to stand up to the rigors of a professional kitchen.
STRAIN EVEN TINY GRAINS AND PASTAS: The holes in this colander are small enough that you can strain most beans, pastas, and grains as well as fruits and vegetables without any worries.
HEAVY DUTY STEEL TO LAST A LIFETIME: High quality steel for a colander that is thicker and more durable than any colander you’ve ever had. Easy cleanup - just run it through the dishwasher.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars3,884 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
